text: <@U6GNQ7JBU> would you be able to see if its possible for the related posts module to pull back zero results? There was a question on the forum about this but I thought a fallback was in place to pull something (unless its literally implemented in a zero post blog).
i've tested with a bunch of random tags that dont exist in a blog and it kept pulling back posts either way.
The tag and content group id parameters just boost the resulting score
Do you have an example query? It could return zero if no posts fall within the date filter
its in relation to this post from the community: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Related-Posts-Module-handle-case-of-no-posts-found/m-p/217389>
I would imagine if nothing is returned then both the `index` and `count` vars would be zero
or maybe just the index one
Isn't there a `post_formatter` option you can add to call a macro
One of the params passed is a total count of results, you could just check that value and render something else instead <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags>
